posts.text: Follow-up hot take: it is societally toxic that the default corporate structure is C-corp. B-corp should be the standard. Companies that exist specifically and only for profit maximization should be the exception rather than the rule, and their operations should be tightly monitored and regulated.

The most worrying thing about AI hype isn't the possibility that AI will replace everyone (it won't), but how quick so many employers are to jump on that chance.

Contemporary business ethics seems to have completely abandoned the notion that employers have ethical duties towards their employees.
